pull.title: docs: Improve `keypoolrefill` RPC docs
pull.body:
Update `keypoolrefill` RPC docs to make it clear that descriptor wallets have 4 ScriptPubKeyManagers by default and each of them is updated in this command, as suggested https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/29924#issuecomment-2849321859

Closes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/29924

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->

| Stale ACK | [rkrux](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32429#pullrequestreview-2821296596) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->

ACK cd00fb85e9e0997120715e68374462cff0dad7eb given the suggestions are addressed.

I checked that by default there are 4 scriptpubkeymans setup on the first run of the wallet inside `SetupDescriptorScriptPubKeyMans`. Also, ack because the lack of this information has caused an issue to be created.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -336,7 +336,9 @@ RPCHelpMan addmultisigaddress()
 RPCHelpMan keypoolrefill()
 {
     return RPCHelpMan{"keypoolrefill",
-                "\nFills the keypool."+
+                "\nRefills each `ScriptPubKeyManager` keypool in the wallet up to the specified number of new keys.\n"
+                "By default, descriptor wallets have four `ScriptPubKeyManagers` (`wpkh`, `tr`, `pkh`, and `sh-wpkh`), each with 1000 entries.\n"
comments.body: Should probably use `DEFAULT_KEYPOOL_SIZE` instead of hardcoded 1000? Same for the `OUTPUT_TYPES`? Also, `ScriptPubKeyManagers` was never used in user-facing docs, except for one error message. Maybe just use "active ranged descriptor" (or similar)?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -336,7 +336,9 @@ RPCHelpMan addmultisigaddress()
 RPCHelpMan keypoolrefill()
 {
     return RPCHelpMan{"keypoolrefill",
-                "\nFills the keypool."+
+                "\nRefills each `ScriptPubKeyManager` keypool in the wallet up to the specified number of new keys.\n"
+                "By default, descriptor wallets have four `ScriptPubKeyManagers` (`wpkh`, `tr`, `pkh`, and `sh-wpkh`), each with 1000 entries.\n"
+                "Legacy wallet typically uses a single `LegacyScriptPubKeyMan` (which manages both external and internal keypools)\n"+
comments.body: also, now that bdb was removed, no need to add docs for it?

-                "\nFills the keypool."+

+                "By default, descriptor wallets have four `ScriptPubKeyManagers` (`wpkh`, `tr`, `pkh`, and `sh-wpkh`), each with 1000 entries.\n"
comments.body:
Done (for `DEFAULT_KEYPOOL_SIZE` and `ScriptPubKeyManagers`).
Regarding `OUTPUT_TYPES`, I think it may need to be refactored to include it in the RPC documentation due to static initialization.
But for now, I left `keypoolrefill` exactly as `getnewaddress`.

comments.body:
```suggestion
                "Refills each descriptor keypool in the wallet up to the specified number of new keys.\n"
```

nit: This is trimmed anyway.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -336,7 +336,8 @@ RPCHelpMan addmultisigaddress()
 RPCHelpMan keypoolrefill()
 {
     return RPCHelpMan{"keypoolrefill",
-                "\nFills the keypool."+
+                "\nRefills each descriptor keypool in the wallet up to the specified number of new keys.\n"
+                "By default, descriptor wallets have 4 active ranged descriptors (\"legacy\", \"p2sh-segwit\", \"bech32\", and \"bech32m\"), each with " + std::to_string(DEFAULT_KEYPOOL_SIZE) + " entries.\n" +
comments.body:
I don't think to_string is allowed, see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32434

Could use ToString?
